intro: Astragalus rauwolfii, commonly known as goat's head, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny, globular seed pods. The plant thrives in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and drought conditions. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by the development of its characteristic seed pods. Astragalus rauwolfii is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats, playing a role in local ecosystems as a source of food for wildlife.
